title: How to learn LOL from a Dota 2 player's view?
body: First off, **don't kill me**. I have played Dota 2 for quite a while, and I'm looking for a change. I have learnt lanes, roles (very vaguely, unsure which lanes they go in), but I'm just finding it difficult to transition. How do I know where to go as a hero, what champions do (especially if I can't play them if they cost) and what I should buy as the heroes?

replies.body:
Ok, buckle up, you're in for a ride.

League has a much more rigid meta than Dota 2.  In Dota 2, you can do a bunch of different things by way of team comp; solo offlane with trilane in safe lane, solo offlane with jungler, 2-1-2 etc.  In League, you basically have to run solo-lane top, solo mid, jungle, zero-cs-support and Attack Damage carry.  AD is what your right-clicks scale from, rather than primary stat.

We also have ratios on abilities; rather than abilities doing set amounts of damage pre-mitigation, you can power-up your abilities by adding the stat that they scale from.

Damage and durability are basically mutually exclusive concepts here; there's no such thing as a strength carry.  You're not going to see the fed Doom with 2000 health ripping teams to shreds.

You'll find that a lot of the heroes and items look a bit familiar.  Randuin's Omen {{item:3143}} is basically Shiva's Guard.  Warmog's Armor {{item:3083}} is basically Heart of Tarrasque.  Corki is very similar to Gyrocopter.  Cassiopeia is sort of like Medusa, if Medusa were an int carry.

That's just the tip of the iceberg.  Hit me up in game if you want me to explain a bit more.

Next:
Read champion guides by alt+tabbing, unlike in dota where you can just pick a high rated build with explanations when you hover over the skills, and change the build to however the hell you like while in game, in League you have to custom build it outside of the game.

Also,
-Centering your camera to champion isn't double tapping F1,
-Micro-ing in league is less taxing because it auto does shit and all you have to do is ctrl + right click to do whatever you wanted, but your micro doesn't have skills, so you don't have to worry about doing Tab, w, tab w, tab, w, tab, w, Q, LMB, Drag, AA, X, 2, C, Z, M2, M1.
-In League, there isn't really a variety in skills in the champions, they have either similar skill sets to dota, or they have the same skill sets from other champions which they just mix and mash.
-Most items in League are useless as fk as you'll end up wasting gold, there's not much variety for the items in League, it's either get Rabadon's if you're a caster, Infinity Edge, Phantom Dancer, Blade of the Ruined King, Bloodthirster, Quicksilver Sash, Archangels Staff, Rod of Ages, Shoes, Liandry's, Dead Man's Plate, and a few more.  Pretty easy to memorise if you're coming from Dota 2 since we have a wider variety in which all of the items are useful.
-League only has AP, or AD, nothing really much, straight simple, and now Riot is trying to remove everybody's fun by not making troll builds viable because they just want you to play a champion in only one-direction.  You either do your fking role, or you don't.  (RIP AP Yi, AD Teemo, AD TF, AP Tristana, AD Soraka, AD Sona, and lastly, AD Fizz for current meta.)  You could argue that you can still play them like such, but they aren't as effective anymore.
-No couriers, however you have a free teleport to base and you can pick free spells such as flash and heal because when you outplay your opponents they can just say f*ck you to your face and heal and flash away.
-Don't be afraid to yolo in League
In League you don't lose gold when you die.  So just yolo the fk every time you can get a kill without giving a f*ck because you can still flash and heal away (heal gives movement speed).
-No tower diving early levels in league
Basically if you're having trouble in lane you can just tower hug and still get exp because enemy can't deny minions.
-No uphill/downhill mechanics
Don't be afraid to kill an enemy who is up the hill.  Sun Tzu art of war doesn't apply much in League.  You can get away with playing like a retard and still win because League doesn't punish you too hard.
-Backdooring
It's easy to backdoor in League, in Dota you take millions of hits to bring a tower down, but League's turrets are like pudding.  Also, league doesn't have much backdoor mechanic unlike in dota.
-Voice chat
You don't have one.  Play with friends over skype.
-Farming
League farming is like breathing, it's so natural and you will get last hits 90% of the time if you played Dota.  Seriously go try it, it's so easy.
-Runes
You don't need AD runes to be honest if you come from dota, last hit is so easy in League that all you need are attack speed and armor pen runes.
-Skillshots
You can spam so much skillshots in league.  If you're from dota you'll land 90% of them.  Stop doing mana management calculations.  Screw that and just spam skills, you've essentially got infinite mana in league as to dota.  And by the time you've used up all of it somehow, you probably have so much cs you can back and go on a shopping spree with your 6k gold by 10 min.
-Items
Just get boots of speed and 1 health pot.  Last hitting is already easy enough and mana and hp regen is so quick you won't realize what's coming.  Also, if you get the mastery which gives you hp and mana for every last hit, that makes it even better.  Minions in league hit like a pussy, so you shouldn't even have your hp bar going less than 9/10 in the first place.  Boots will make you run like a truck so no one can harass you.
-Harassing
Don't get into enemy champion's range to harass.  You need to get used to what their skills are, in which case, unfortunately, you have to grind IP to be able to counter them unlike in dota where you can try everyone for free.  So this needs in game knowledge really.
But generally:
when enemy melee champ comes near, poke and run.  They can't land a single skillshot on to you because there is no turn rate in league and you run as fast as  a ninja with those boots.
when an enemy ranged comes near to harass, run, or trade blows (not recommended since you're trying to be a farming god, and not have enemy jg to pop out and kill you), and when they try to go for cs, poke and run, which compensates for you denying the minion.
- Pub games
Generally you can just go out of your lane when it's safe and when there is no cs to be taken (like when lane is pushed and under their tower, you don't want to get ganked), so ward the river or enemy jungle and take their buffs when you see that it is safe (i.e. Enemy jungler is ganking another lane, and all 5 are on the map).  They will be so pissed.
- Get a sightstone
Most people think this is a bad investment, but since you'll be getting your core so fast due to ez last hits thy won't see it coming that you can just buy a sighstone which gives you FREE wards.  Did someone say free?  Not only that, you can plant 3 at ONCE. and when you go back to base, you refresh their CHARGES SO YOU CAN WARD MORE.  Best item in my opinion for a player coming from Dota.  Vision wins games, play strategically, learn when and when not to engage, you can do so much with wards (which only costs 800 gold and gives you HP at the same time).
- Play passively early game and as safe as you can
Since it's so easy to dodge skillshots which you have no turn rate as well, might as well keep farming for your tools.  I guarantee that in pub matches that people will be so mad that they can't hit you that they are prone to charge in and make mistakes, which of course you can punish them by slapping their arse and give them a good beating, kill them if you have to, but be careful to not overextend unless you have vision of your surroundings (buy wards) in which you can kill.  If they play passively as well, it's all good because you're bound to complete your build earlier because you get to last hit better than them.  Although it might be tempting to last hit from high hp, please don't let that ruin your dota career in the future, as it can make a bad habit.
-Meta
the current meta will be that people will try to push your tower as soon as possible.  Punish them so hard by getting a jungler to gank when they AA all the time.  You get a free kill that way.  If you're jungler is dumb enough not to gank, not to worry, you get so much advantage  this way as well as the enemy spends most of their time in frustration that they can't kill you under the tower, and that they can't farm when minions are under the tower, leading to them making mistakes by trying to get a hit on you if you are able to be hit under tower whenever possible, and wa-lah, you just basically traded hits with them, with you dodging all their skillshots and you landing all of your skillshots on them.  Please volvo, what is turn rate?
- Don't let LoL spoonfeeding make you a bad player!
Don't get caught out of position for gods sake.  You can troll by yoloing in if you wanted, but that doesn't mean feeding their carry a penta kill because of your stupidity.
- Heroes to win with which are easy to play.
* Blitzcrank - oh my god this dude is cancer.  Basically you can literally just either hook someone to your tower (because the map is so small), or you run up to enemy up punch them in the face and do aoe silence.  Build full ap on this dude because you will literally wreck havoc everywhere and squishy ADC or APC will be so mad at getting killed so easily with 1 30 second ult (or lower due to cd reduct, your choice).  Or you could play tank, but who needs that when you can dodge all ss, have a free barrier if you screw up, free heal if you screw up, free flash if you screw up, low hook cd if you screw up, low overdrive cd if you screw up, low punch cd if you screw up, low ult cd if you screw up.  You can turn a fight into a 5v5 to a 3v5 with proper positioning in a teamfight (support and adc or apc are generally squishy).
* Vayne - jesus, this champ is so easy to play as, and she has the highest adc in the game.  The jungle is essentially yours and all you have to do when a %%%got 1v1s you is ult, Q, E, and do the right click of death and  spam Q.  Get Furor enchantment on boots and you'll essentially be kiting them so hard and tumbling away to tumblr heaven.  BoTRK for more kiting and attck speed madness, as well as escape. When running, Q away, hit, and ur furor enchantment will get you running in no time, Q, condemn them to wall, and run again like the bastard you are, Q, hit, and then use BoTRK, rinse and repeat.  By the time the enemy with higher mobility than you has come along, your team will be there by then to help you, or if it's him alone (watch map), generally high mobil champs are squshy as hell and just condemn them to wall and right click of death please.  If they are tanky, your name isn't vayne if you can't shred a tank with your high damage, high mobility kit, stealth, amp amp amp dmg, 2 second Q cd, a stun, a passive which deals true damage on every third hit.  (with your items, you essentially deal over 40 percent damage to tanks in just 3 hits!  and you still have your botrk 10% damage of their max hp, plus stealing their move speed to kite them, AND you can deal 6 hits (16 percent of their max hp from passive W only ;D) + botrk current hp dmg each hit, plus your Q resets AA if you Q on a wall and it deals 50% increase base damage, and your ult deals a fuck ton of added dmg, plus your items which amps even MORE DAMAGe and ends up killing your targets in 9 hits in 4 seconds essentially. 

Gosh im tired.  Whelp imm off to sleep.

Is there any way to see the hero that you're up against's abilities??
You can click on any champ's portrait in champ select to see what their abilities are.

Use the LoL wiki: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/League_of_Legends_Wiki

Also, to find out information about matchups, look at a guide: http://www.lolking.net/guides/

1. What I did when I started playing was whenever I was in queue waiting for a game, I would go into the store, pick a champion and look at his abilities, lores and tips. This is a good way to both pass the time, understand what certain champions do and help you find a champion you like. (I found heimerdonger this way {{champion:74}})
For a long time I wasn't too sure about champion abilities. It comes with experience that you will learn an idea of what they all do though!

You can use the league website as a sort of guide. On the top left you'll see the link 'Game Info' and, when you mouse over that, you'll see the link 'Champions'. You can use that page to look up a champion and browse their abilities.

> Is there any way to see the hero that you're up against's abilities??

no, unless you die to them, in which case it shows the 3 things that did the most damage to you. most people know what the abilities of other champs do.

This is a piece of advice I like to give to every new player. People have already told you about what kind of people go in each lane, so I won't touch on that.  It may help you to prioritise getting some champions who can work multiple lanes first. For example, a lot of mages like Karma, Lulu or Morgana can easily go as mid or support. Diana can go mid or jungle. It isn't unheard of for Vayne or Quinn to go to top or bottom, and the same goes for Zed. And of course, a lot of top laners can work the jungle and vise versa. I'd suggest you go for champions who can work multiple lanes so you don't have to learn to many champions when you start, and so that you may get lanes filled with the IP costs!
Remember, it is double IP weekend too!
also, try looking up guides for champs, when i first started playing league they really helped cause they gave me a good idea of what to build on champs in certain situations.
